title: What exactly is a 60-something woman supposed to look like in 2019 (if you're not Jane Seymour)?
text:
Really Unfair Story of the Week: the actress Jane Seymour (usually known as the eternally girlish Jane Seymour) has been experiencing reverse age discrimination.

Eternally girlish Jane is, in reality, a solid, pension-drawing 68 – would you believe – and keen to act her actual age.

The problem is, there just isn’t the work for 68-year-old actresses who look more like 58, or 48, or whatever age JS looks to the average civilian on the street. Thirty? Anyway: if they want someone to play “older”, they call Helen Mirren.

This is fiendishly confusing territory. We thought we were all obliged to look younger than our passport age. So if there is a “Woah, Bit Too Young-Looking Considering Your Actual...
description: Really Unfair Story of the Week:
